Interface IPropagable

All Known Implementing Classes:
InputNode, Neuron
public interface IPropagable
Class representative of a node that can propagate a matrix of values through a network. The main purpose is to be used as a node/neuron in a machine learning neural network.

  • Method Details

    • output

      Matrix output()
      Returns:
      the output of the current node

    • ghostOutput

      Matrix ghostOutput()
      Returns:
      the ghost output of the current node

    • connect

      void connect(IPropagable that, double weight)
      connects two nodes with a given weight. (directional)
      Parameters:
      that - the node to connect to
      weight - the weight of the connection

    • connect

      void connect(IPropagable that)
      connects to a node, with a random weight
      Parameters:
      that - the node to connect to

    • resetCaches

      void resetCaches()
      propagates forward through the network, clearing caches.

    • propagate

      void propagate()
      performs a forward propagation. (caches results for backpropagation)

    • ghostpropagate

      void ghostpropagate()
      performs a forward propagation. !!!does not cache results for backpropagation!!!

    • backpropagate

      void backpropagate(Matrix deltas, double learningRate, int numOutputs)
      performs a backpropagation. resets caches automatically.
      Parameters:
      deltas - the deltas from the calling node (error term)
      learningRate - the learning rate
      numOutputs - number of output nodes in the graph

    • backConnect

      void backConnect(IPropagable that, double connWeight)
      saves a connection as a backwards connection. (against the direction of the connection)
      Parameters:
      that - the node to register the connection
      connWeight - the connection weight

    • fwrdConnect

      void fwrdConnect(IPropagable that)
      saves a forward connection
      Parameters:
      that - the node to connect to

    • weights

      Matrix weights()
      first index (0) is the bias
      Returns:
      the weights of the connections of the current node

    • bias

      double bias()
      Returns:
      the bias of the node

    • name

      String name()
      a string representation of the node.
      Returns:
      the node's name

    • getWeightInfo

      ArrayList<String> getWeightInfo(ArrayList<String> previousInfo)
      propagates forward, collecting information about the weights.
      Parameters:
      previousInfo - the previous weight information list
      Returns:
      the new weight information list
